The City of Smithville is governed by a Council-Manager form of government in which the Council establishes City policy through ordinances and resolutions, and the City Manager carries out City policy and is responsible for City operations. The Smithville City Council consists of the Mayor and five Council members. The Mayor and Council are elected at large, which means they represent the entire City, and all registered voters may vote for all six places.

May 3, 2025, General Election - Early Voting and Election Day Voting to be held at the Rec Center located at 106 Royston Street, Smithville, Texas

The requirements/qualifications to serve on the Smithville City Council are as follows:

  • To be eligible to be a candidate for, or elected or appointed to, a public elective office in this state, a person must:
    • Be 18 years of age or older on the first day of the term to be filled at the election or on the date of appointment, as applicable.
  • Have resided continuously in the state for 12 months and in the territory from which the office is elected for six months immediately preceding the following date:

If you have any questions, please contact Jennifer Lynch, City Secretary at Phone number: 512-237-3282 Ext 2106 or via email at Email Jennifer Lynch.

Si tiene una pregunta, por favor llame a Jennifer Lynch, Secretaria de la Ciudad de Smithville a Phone number: 512-237-3282, ext. 2106 or por el correo electronico a Email Jennifer Lynch

The Texas Workforce Commission ("TWC") is the entity responsible for enforcing the Fair Housing Act in the State of Texas. You have one year after an alleged violation to file a complaint, but you should file it as soon as possible.
